detailsOfAchievement: Gopi Yuva Mandal Allahabad is registered Society. It is registered under Society Registration Act 21,1860 .It was registered on dated 18th January two thousand ten at the regional office of Firm Society and chits in Allahabad of Uttar Pradesh. Validity of the registration certificate is till 18th January 2020.From its inception Society is providing its services in different fields. Our society is conducting different types of activities in rural and urban areas of district Allahabad. Different types of problems are increasing day by day in our society. It is our moral duty to do some social work among community for removing the problems. Our society has taken a stand to run different activities in society. The activities which has been carried out by the society in financial year 2015-2016 is mention under. 1.AWARENESS PROGRAMME Awareness is a second chain of education .Our success is depend on education.Development of our country is depend on edujcation .It is need of our country to expand the literacy rate.Rural literacy rate of our counry is very poor.Rural women are not getting education.Their life style is closed in corner of house fence.Women are needed to educate so they promote thier children towards education.Our society conducted five awareness programme at five different places. 2.WORKSHOP ON PANCHAYATI RAJ. System of Panchayat is very old arrangement of villages.Panchayat is a system which solved the problems of local people.responsibility of village development is in hand of panchayat.Some important works have been given to panchayat representative .with purpose to give prop;er information under panchayati raj systems our society organise two workshop in Allahabad District. 3.WOMEN DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME. Looking the need and necessity of the programme ,our soiety organised women development programme in rural villages of Allahabad .under the programme society provided a message to villagers  Save and See futureAddressing the participants secretary of the society said women have a habbit to save money .we should not run behind the glammers. 4.VOCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAMMES. Most people of our counry is unskilled.they are facing problem in life .therefore different types of new problems are increasing very fast in our life.in scarcity of money we are not sending our children to schnool.They are working hard but getting very few.This systems of our country should be removed .One should be skilled.Looking the necessity of training our society started three months computer training programmes to boys and girls. 5.CULTURAL PROGRAMMES Gopi Yuva Mandal organised two cultural programme on the day of his foundation on dated 18th January 2016 at the head office of the organisation.Roal play against dowry system was played on the munch.Addressing the people secretary of the society said cultural programme is good resources to give the realistic picture of the society to people.

detailsOfAchievement: GEAG is a non-profit organisation working in the field of environment and sustainable development since 1975. GEAG has been actively engaged in implementing several development projects. In last five years, the organisation was involved in implementing eight major development projects, supported by national and international donors, on livelihood issues of small and marginal farmers, particularly women farmers and landless, urban poor and health. These development projects have set model examples of integration of local wisdom and science, bottom up approach and urban resilience. Through its researches, advocacy and networking, GEAG is recognized as prominent resource organization in north India in the field of sustainable agriculture, participatory approaches-methodology, gender sensitization and community empowerment. GEAG had been nominated a member of the state agriculture advisory Committee by Agriculture ministry of UP due to outstanding contribution in enhancement of adaptive capacity of marginalized farming communities to the impact of climate change. Along with three projects in rural areas, in last five years, GEAG has also undertaken two projects concentrating on urban poverty, focusing on food insecurity with experimenting and promoting urban climate change resilience in four urban centres of the states-UP, Bihar, Assam and West Bengal Presently, GEAG is a well established implementing, resource, consultative and support organization in North India with expertise on Low Cost External Input Sustainable Agriculture ( LEISA),Livelihood models , Climate Change adaptation issue, Disaster Risk Reduction and Gender equality.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The purpose of this project is to enhance the process of UCCR through civil society organisations and urban local bodies and to incorporate climate projections in designing of resilient systems, improved understanding of correlation between urban systems, its management, not only by users, but also managers of the cities in bringing appropriate public policies and rules.
The core objective of this project is to establish a community managed DEWATS which can treat domestic water and the treated wastewater can be recycled and reused for irrigation and washing purposes

detailsOfAchievement: GRAM NIYOJAN KENDRA Gram Niyojan Kendra (G.N.K.) is 37 years old organization registered in 1977. The main Office is located at Adhyatmiknagar, Dasna, Ghaziabad and the project offices are located at Nautanwa, Maharajganj, (Uttar Pradesh) and Roopwas, Bharatpur, (Rajasthan). Present programmes /activities of the Kendra : 1. Livelihood promotion and empowerment of women with special emphasis on girls / women belonging to excluded groups, scheduled caste and Muslims - The programme aims at empowering women to plan and manage their livelihood programme and to emerge as equal partners in the families. So for it has covered 15000 youth (girls/ women) have been trained in different trades since 1990. 2. Family Counselling Centre: Family Counselling Centre known as Nav Deepti was established in 1989. The Centre is supported by U.P. State Social Welfare Advisory Board, Lucknow to support families and individuals, in both rural and urban areas. 3. Child centered Community development programme in 80 villages spreadover four blocks of Maharajganj, Uttar Pradesh - Activities organized include improving education, health care, early child hood development and child protection from abuse and exploitation, and disaster risk management. 4. Area development programme to control / prevent involvement of children in smuggling / prostitution / trafficking activities in Maharajganj district of Uttar Pradesh and Roopwas Tahsil of Bharatpur district, Rajasthan - Multiple activities are organized and these include education, heath, awareness generation for change of mind set of people, and organization of a High School at Roopwas. 5. SAKSHAM PROJECT Supported by Axis Bank Foundation through Plan India to improve the livelihoods of 2,000 VOCSETs and WAA in Districts of Uttar Pradesh, Namely, Maharajganj. 6. COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAMME FOR IMPROVING QUALITY OF LIFE OF CHILDREN IN JHUGGI JHOPRI CLUSTER OF VASUNDHARA AND INDIRAPURAM, GHAZIABAD. 7. MISSING AND TRAFFICKED CHILDREN: Recently, it organised a partnership programme on Missing and Trafficked Children covering fourteen border districts of Bihar(7) and Uttar Pradesh(7). 8. CHILDREN IN DIFFICULT CIRCUMSTANCES IN NORTHERN INDIA: Recently, Kendra organised 8 state level consultation and one regional conference. 9. Publication: Eleven publication mainly on issues of Prostitutes and Prostitution. 10. Organisation of Seminar/Conferences at local and regional level. 11. Conducting Research Studies 12. GNK AND CSR  PARTNERSHIP WITH THE INDUSTRIES: a) Social Development Programme in Partnership with Hindustan Coca Cola Beverages Ltd. Ghaziabad in five villages of Dholana Block since 1999. b) Training of Health Attendants  so far trained 101. b) Right Based Social Development Programme in Partnership with Micromatic Grinding Technologies Ltd. in two villages Rehispur and Sadarpur of Ghaziabad. c) Integrated Comprehensive Development Programme in Partnership with Continental Carbon India Ltd. Ghaziabad in Chipiyana and Dundaheda two villages of Ghaziabad. Organisational Structure: The organization has three tier structure namely: Managing Committee, General Body and Staff. Managing Committee  11 members including three office bearers General Body: 17 members Staff: About 150 workers to carry on day to day activities of the Kendra. Staff members are trained in their work committed and loyal to the organization.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: UP State Social Welfare Advisory Board
sourceOfFunds.purpose: To provide counselling support to women and families facing domestic issues. This centre is quite in demand since there are no such services available to the families particularly in the rural areas of Ghaziabad. However the centre also caters to urban families and is open to anybody who face any domestic problems. FCC team organised AGP camps for women at community level to increase awareness of women about the need and importance of counselling for improving better family relationship.

The centre is supported by Central Social Welfare Board through, Uttar Pradesh State Social Welfare Board. The Centre was set up to meet the growing needs for counselling and legal aid to families, in order to deal with the day to day problems and family discord. The centres organises awareness generation camps, personal visits and mohalla meeting, in the urban slums and rural areas of Ghaziabad, to inform community members of the availability of such services and encourage them to seek help w

The intervention is being implemented in 20 Gram Panchayats in Kodia Block of Gorakhpur District Uttar Pradesh. The activities focus on empowerment of persons with disability and strengthening community based rehabilitation.

Control and prevention of trafficking and exploitation of children and women in Narkatiyaganj block, West Champaran, Bihar GNK is working across 40 villages of Narkatiaganj block, district West Champaran, Bihar to prevention exploitation and trafficking of children and women. The interventions cover 14521 families in the area.
